title: Romantic Valentine single-page with evasive No button and Yes confirmation meme

requirements.text: Create a single-page romantic Valentine prompt UI that asks: "Will you be my Valentine?" and shows exactly two options: "Yes" and "No".

quotes:
Create an interactive web page... to ask her to be my Valentine.

There should be two options: Yes or No.

acceptanceCriteria: On load, the page shows one clear Valentine question and two buttons labeled "Yes" and "No".
No other primary user flows/actions are presented besides answering the question.

requirements.text: Implement an evasive "No" button interaction: when the user tries to hover over or otherwise target the "No" button (pointer enter / mouse move / touch attempt), the button should move to a different position within the visible page area so it cannot be clicked.

quotes: When she hovers her cursor over No, it should move away so she cannot click it, forcing her to click only on Yes.

acceptanceCriteria: On desktop, moving the cursor toward the "No" button causes it to reposition before a click can occur.
On iPad/touch devices, attempting to tap/press the "No" button triggers the repositioning (i.e., the interaction does not rely solely on hover).
The "No" button always stays fully visible within the viewport and does not overlap the "Yes" button or the main question text.

requirements.text: When the user clicks "Yes", replace the prompt/buttons with a celebratory view that displays a meme image containing the text: "Good choice".

quotes: When she clicks Yes, show her a meme image telling her "Good choice

acceptanceCriteria: Clicking "Yes" transitions to a success state (same page) that prominently shows the generated meme image.
The meme image visibly includes the exact text "Good choice".
After entering the success state, the "No" button is no longer shown.

requirements.text: Apply a consistent romantic visual theme using a pink and white color scheme, with a cohesive, playful style appropriate for a Valentine surprise page.

quotes: The page should be themed romantically with a pink and white color scheme

acceptanceCriteria: The page uses pink/white as the dominant palette across background, buttons, and typography.
Typography, spacing, and component styling feel intentionally romantic/cohesive (not default browser styling).
Layout renders cleanly on iPad Chrome in both portrait and landscape orientations (no clipped primary content).

requirements.text: Add the required generated image(s) as static assets under frontend/public/assets/generated and reference them directly from the frontend (do not fetch images from the backend).

quotes: show her a meme image telling her "Good choice

acceptanceCriteria: The app loads the meme image from a static path under /assets/generated/ without backend calls.
The image renders correctly in the "Yes" success state in local/dev builds.

constraints: Use only the provided stack (React + TypeScript + Tailwind + React Query where relevant); do not introduce other frameworks.
Do not modify any files under frontend/src/components/ui or any other frontend immutablePaths listed in SYSTEM_CONTEXT.
No backend changes are required for this single-page interaction (keep backend unused unless strictly necessary).
nonGoals: User accounts or authentication (including Internet Identity).
Multiple pages/routes or additional mini-games/interactions beyond the Yes/No Valentine prompt and the Yes success view.

required: Meme-style image with the text "Good choice" in a romantic/funny aesthetic (valentine-good-choice-meme.dim_1024x1024.png)
